info.title: Mantis Bug Tracker REST API
info.description:
Mantis Bug Tracker (MantisHub) REST APIs.
REST API calls have to be authenticated by creating an API token for the user doing the calls, and then passing the API token in the 'Authorization' header.  However, for anonymous access, the API key and header are not needed.

tags.name: Issues
tags.description: A set of REST API for handling issues.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: A set of REST APIs for handling projects.

delete.description: Deletes an issue given its id. Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

get.description: Get all files associated with an issue. Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

parameters.name: issue_id
parameters.description: The issue id to get files for

post.description: Add attachments to an existing issue. Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

get.description: Get a single file from an issue. Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.
This is a standard filter that gets unassigned issues. Available since MantisBT 2.10.0.

post.description: Create an issue with attachments Available since MantisBT 2.12.0.
Shows the creation of issue with minimal information.Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

post.summary: Create an issue note with attachment
post.description: Create an issue note with an associated attachment. Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.  Attachments supported since MantisBT 2.11.0.

delete.description: Delete an issue note. Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

post.description: Have one or more users monitor the specified issue.  The users can be identified via:- - id - their user id. - name - their username - email - their email address - name_or_realname - a string that corresponds to their username or real name. If user id is not specified, the logged in user id is added to the issue as the monitoring user. If user id is not the same as logged in user id, a high access level is required which enables adding other users to the monitor list. Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

post.summary: Detach a tag from an issue
post.description: Detach a tag from an issue. Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.
Delete an issue relationship. Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

delete.description: Delete an issue relationship. Available since MantisBT 2.6.0.

get.description: Get all projects and sub-projects accessible to user. Available since MantisBT 2.5.0.

projects.name: mantisbt
projects.description: Mantis.  Report problems with the actual bug tracker here. (Do not remove this account)

versions.description:
MantisBT 1.2.20 is the final maintenance and security release for the 1.2.x series. 
All installations that are currently running any 1.2.x version are strongly advised to upgrade. 

This release resolves 3 security and a couple of PHP 7 compatibility issues.

versions.name: 2.0.0-beta.1
versions.description: MantisBT 2.0.0 release focuses on improvements to the UI compared to 1.3.x release. As of this release, the db schema is the same between 1.3.x and 2.0.0-beta.1, enabling users to easily try 2.0.0-beta.1 and provide feedback.

versions.name: Backlog
versions.description: Issues accepted but not yet assigned to a release.

post.description: Create a project. Available since MantisBT 2.17.0.

example.name: _new2
example.description: Mantis.  Report problems with the actual bug tracker here. (Do not remove this account)

get.description: Get a project given its id. Available since MantisBT 2.14.0.

patch.description: Update a project. Available since MantisBT 2.17.0.

delete.description: Deletes a sub-project from parent project.  Note that this doesn't delete data associated with sub-project. Available since MantisBT 2.20.0.

post.description: Add a subproject to the specified project id. Available since MantisBT 2.20.0.

patch.description: Update the subproject relationship properties. Available since MantisBT 2.20.0.

post.description: Add a project version. Only name field is required. Timestamp accepts date formats that can be parsed by PHP strtotime(). Available since MantisBT 2.15.0.
